##

CVE-2024-5158(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-22T18:30:50

1 posts

Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.76 allowed a remote attacker to potentially perform arbitrary read/write via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-25T17:38:59.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) Chromium security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.
  • CVE-2024-5274 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses these vulnerabilities. Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

Note: These vulnerabilities were disclosed on Tuesday 21 May 2024 (see parent toot above) and the zero-day on Thursday 23 May 2024.

#CVE_2024_5157 #CVE_2024_5158 #CVE_2024_5159 #CVE_2024_5160 #CVE_2024_5274 #vulnerability #CVE #MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome

##

CVE-2024-5159(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-22T18:30:50

1 posts

Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.76 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory read via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-25T17:38:59.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) Chromium security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.
  • CVE-2024-5274 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses these vulnerabilities. Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

Note: These vulnerabilities were disclosed on Tuesday 21 May 2024 (see parent toot above) and the zero-day on Thursday 23 May 2024.

#CVE_2024_5157 #CVE_2024_5158 #CVE_2024_5159 #CVE_2024_5160 #CVE_2024_5274 #vulnerability #CVE #MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome

##

CVE-2024-5157(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-22T18:30:45

1 posts

Use after free in Scheduling in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.76 allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-25T17:38:59.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) Chromium security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.
  • CVE-2024-5274 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses these vulnerabilities. Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

Note: These vulnerabilities were disclosed on Tuesday 21 May 2024 (see parent toot above) and the zero-day on Thursday 23 May 2024.

#CVE_2024_5157 #CVE_2024_5158 #CVE_2024_5159 #CVE_2024_5160 #CVE_2024_5274 #vulnerability #CVE #MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome

wvu at 2024-06-03T20:04:17.393Z ##

PSA: curl can do variables. Example using Nexus CVE-2024-4956:

curl -v --variable hax=////../../../../etc/passwd --expand-url http://127.0.0.2:8081/{{hax:url}}

https://everything.curl.dev/cmdline/variables.html

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T13:24:02.034Z ##

SOCRadar warns of cybercriminal interest in CVE-2024-4956, (7.5 high, disclosed 16 May 2024 by Sonatype) a path traversal vulnerability (cc: @reverseics) in Sonatype Nexus Repository 3 allowing for file read. Proof of concept is available.

##

CVE-2024-30040
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.94%

updated 2024-05-14T18:31:15

2 posts

Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

avolha at 2024-06-05T11:42:26.483Z ##

Pozwólcie, że coś wyjaśnię, bo nie pierwszy już raz widzę takie kwiatki w serwisie dobreprogramy. Autor omawia majowe aktualizacje Microsoftu i narzeka na "CVSS z Księżyca" i rzekomą inflację w procesie szacowania skali zagrożenia. Chodzi m.in. o lukę CVE-2024-30040 w MSHTML, czyli w silniku Internet Explorera (mimo że sama przeglądarka z systemu została usunięta, to jej silnik nadal jest używany do renderowania zawartości webowej w dokumentach Office). W skali CVSS przyznano jej 8,8 pkt. - zdaniem autora o wiele za dużo, bo efektywne wykorzystanie luki wymaga od użytkownika samodzielnego pobrania i otwarcia złośliwego pliku, więc pff! gdzie tu wielkie zagrożenie? Szkopuł w tym, że właśnie ta luka jest już aktywnie używana w atakach - ktoś się nabiera, pobiera, otwiera i dochodzi do infekcji, czyli warto tę lukę w trybie pilnym załatać. Wypadałoby przed rozpoczęciem narzekania doczytać sobie to i owo.

#infosec #cyberbezpieczenstwo #microsoft

##
avolha@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-05T11:42:26.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-30043
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-05-14T18:31:05

4 posts

Microsoft SharePoint Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability

1 repos

https://github.com/W01fh4cker/CVE-2024-30043-XXE

screaminggoat at 2024-05-31T18:54:38.201Z ##

Zero Day Initiative (ZDI): CVE-2024-30043: Abusing Url Parsing Confusion To Exploit XXE On Sharepoint Server And Cloud
Piotr Bazydło covers CVE-2024-30043 (6.5 medium, disclosed 14 May 2024 by Microsoft) Microsoft SharePoint Server information disclosure vulnerability, referred to as an XML eXternal Entity (XXE) injection vulnerability. His motivation for writing it is the attractiveness (to an attacker) of a vulnerability affecting both on-prem and cloud SharePoint instances, and that "This is one of the craziest XXEs that I have ever seen (and found), both in terms of vulnerability discovery and the method of triggering." The impact of CVE-2024-30043 allows for file read with SharePoint Farm Service account permission, Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) attacks, NTLM relay attacks, and other XXE side effects.

This blog includes such gems like "Who cares anyway? YOLO and let’s move along with the exploitation." Piotr provides a detailed walkthrough leading to the exploitation, along with a Proof of Concept.

#CVE_2024_30043 #XXE #SharePoint #vulnerability #CVE #rootcauseanalysis #proofofconcept

##
thezdi at 2024-05-30T15:47:52.277Z ##

CVE-2024-30043: @chudypb details this #SharePoint XXE he discovered. He calls it one of the craziest XXEs he has ever seen (and found), both in terms of vulnerability discovery and the method of triggering. He shows how it can be used for info disclosure & NTLM relaying. https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/blog/2024/5/29/cve-2024-30043-abusing-url-parsing-confusion-to-exploit-xxe-on-sharepoint-server-and-cloud

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-31T18:54:38.000Z ##

Piotr Bazydło covers CVE-2024-30043 (6.5 medium, disclosed 14 May 2024 by Microsoft) Microsoft SharePoint Server information disclosure vulnerability, referred to as an XML eXternal Entity (XXE) injection vulnerability. His motivation for writing it is the attractiveness (to an attacker) of a vulnerability affecting both on-prem and cloud SharePoint instances, and that "This is one of the craziest XXEs that I have ever seen (and found), both in terms of vulnerability discovery and the method of triggering." The impact of CVE-2024-30043 allows for file read with SharePoint Farm Service account permission, Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) attacks, NTLM relay attacks, and other XXE side effects.

This blog includes such gems like "Who cares anyway? YOLO and let’s move along with the exploitation." Piotr provides a detailed walkthrough leading to the exploitation, along with a Proof of Concept.

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-05-14T18:30:45

1 posts

An issue was discovered on certain Nuki Home Solutions devices. The HTTP API exposed by a Bridge used an unencrypted channel to provide an administrative interface. A token can be easily eavesdropped by a malicious actor to impersonate a legitimate user and gain access to the full set of API endpoints. This affects Nuki Bridge v1 before 1.22.0 and v2 before 2.13.2.

CVE-2024-23897
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.09%

updated 2024-05-14T17:57:02

1 posts

Jenkins has a built-in command line interface (CLI) to access Jenkins from a script or shell environment. Jenkins uses the args4j library to parse command arguments and options on the Jenkins controller when processing CLI commands. This command parser has a feature that replaces an @ character followed by a file path in an argument with the file’s contents (expandAtFiles). This feature is enable

CVE-2024-29212
(9.9 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T16:13:02.773000

1 posts

Due to an unsafe de-serialization method used by the Veeam Service Provider Console(VSPC) server in communication between the management agent and its components, under certain conditions, it is possible to perform Remote Code Execution (RCE) on the VSPC server machine.

zeljkazorz@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-28T18:05:02.000Z ##

Veeam has issued an “enhanced update” to address CVE-2024-29212, an RCE flaw in its Service Provider Console (VSPC).

Sounds like an incomplete first patch:

“Although our initial patch, issued on May 7th, effectively addressed the primary concern, a subsequent review identified an area for further improvement. To ensure comprehensive protection, we swiftly developed and released a refined patch that fully mitigates the issue.”

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/05/08/cve-2024-29212/

#Veeam #Backup #CVE #Cybersecurity

The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

decio at 2024-05-30T08:46:12.543Z ##

Une vulnérabilité dans macOS Sonoma (CVE-2024-27842) permet une élévation de privilèges via le système de fichiers UDF et les fonctions IOCTL, exécutant du code avec des privilèges kernel. Le PoC a été publié.

Apple a corrigé cette faille dans macOS 14.5
👇
https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT214106

CVE-2024-34342
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-08T10:10:23

2 posts

### Summary If PDF.js is used to load a malicious PDF, and PDF.js is configured with `isEvalSupported` set to `true` (which is the default value), unrestricted attacker-controlled JavaScript will be executed in the context of the hosting domain. ### Patches [This patch](https://github.com/wojtekmaj/react-pdf/commit/671e6eaa2e373e404040c13cc6b668fe39839cad) forces `isEvalSupported` to `false`, re

1 repos

https://github.com/LOURC0D3/CVE-2024-4367-PoC

DarkWebInformer at 2024-05-31T14:11:16.782Z ##

🚨POC RELEASED🚨CVE-2024-4367 & CVE-2024-34342: Arbitrary JavaScript execution in PDF.js

#DarkWeb #Cybersecurity #Security #Cyberattack #Cybercrime #Privacy #Infosec #Vulnerability

"A type check was missing when handling fonts in PDF.js, which would allow arbitrary JavaScript execution in the PDF.js context. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126, Firefox ESR < 115.11, and Thunderbird < 115.11.

If pdf.js is used to load a malicious PDF, and PDF.js is configured with isEvalSupported set to true (which is the default value), unrestricted attacker-controlled JavaScript will be executed in the context of the hosting domain."

https://x.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1796544839464452335

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-31T14:11:16.000Z ##

"A type check was missing when handling fonts in PDF.js, which would allow arbitrary JavaScript execution in the PDF.js context. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126, Firefox ESR < 115.11, and Thunderbird < 115.11.

If pdf.js is used to load a malicious PDF, and PDF.js is configured with isEvalSupported set to true (which is the default value), unrestricted attacker-controlled JavaScript will be executed in the context of the hosting domain."

##

CVE-2024-4367(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-07T10:26:15

2 posts

### Impact If pdf.js is used to load a malicious PDF, and PDF.js is configured with `isEvalSupported` set to `true` (which is the default value), unrestricted attacker-controlled JavaScript will be executed in the context of the hosting domain. ### Patches The patch removes the use of `eval`: https://github.com/mozilla/pdf.js/pull/18015 ### Workarounds Set the option `isEvalSupported` to `false`

CVE-2024-2961(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-04T03:30:45

11 posts

The iconv() function in the GNU C Library versions 2.39 and older may overflow the output buffer passed to it by up to 4 bytes when converting strings to the ISO-2022-CN-EXT character set, which may be used to crash an application or overwrite a neighbouring variable.

CVE-2023-45288
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-02T18:59:06

2 posts

An attacker may cause an HTTP/2 endpoint to read arbitrary amounts of header data by sending an excessive number of CONTINUATION frames. Maintaining HPACK state requires parsing and processing all HEADERS and CONTINUATION frames on a connection. When a request's headers exceed MaxHeaderBytes, no memory is allocated to store the excess headers, but they are still parsed. This permits an attacker to

1 repos

https://github.com/hex0punk/cont-flood-poc

CVE-2023-6961
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-05-02T18:31:03

2 posts

The WP Meta SEO plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘Referer’ header in all versions up to, and including, 4.5.12 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-07T02:13:53.157Z ##

SecureLayer7: Analysis of CVE-2024-27348 Apache HugeGraph
Note: SecureLayer7 miswrote the CVE ID in their own title. For all the attention to detail in their analysis, you would think they'd notice a CVE ID missing a number.
CVE-2024-27348 (9.8 critical, disclosed 22 April 2024 by Apache) Remote Command Execution vulnerability in Apache HugeGraph-Server. An attacker can bypass the sandbox restrictions and achieve RCE through Gremlin, resulting in complete control over the server. SecureLayer7 performs patch diffing to understand the root cause (inadequate or missing reflections filtering in the SecurityManager). "This allowed us to access and manipulate various methods, ultimately enabling us to change the task/thread name to bypass all security checks. It was patched by filtering critical system classes and adding new security checks in HugeSecurityManager." Proof of Concept provided.

See related The Register article: POC exploit code published for 9.8-rated Apache HugeGraph RCE flaw

#CVE_2024_27348 #Apache #Hugegraph #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #Poc

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T02:13:53.000Z ##

SecureLayer7: Analysis of CVE-2024-27348 Apache HugeGraph
Note: SecureLayer7 miswrote the CVE ID in their own title. For all the attention to detail in their analysis, you would think they'd notice a CVE ID missing a number.
CVE-2024-27348 (9.8 critical, disclosed 22 April 2024 by Apache) Remote Command Execution vulnerability in Apache HugeGraph-Server. An attacker can bypass the sandbox restrictions and achieve RCE through Gremlin, resulting in complete control over the server. SecureLayer7 performs patch diffing to understand the root cause (inadequate or missing reflections filtering in the SecurityManager). "This allowed us to access and manipulate various methods, ultimately enabling us to change the task/thread name to bypass all security checks. It was patched by filtering critical system classes and adding new security checks in HugeSecurityManager." Proof of Concept provided.

See related The Register article: POC exploit code published for 9.8-rated Apache HugeGraph RCE flaw

#CVE_2024_27348 #Apache #Hugegraph #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #Poc

##

CVE-2024-1086
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.97%

updated 2024-05-01T18:31:14

21 posts

A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's netfilter: nf_tables component can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. The nft_verdict_init() function allows positive values as drop error within the hook verdict, and hence the nf_hook_slow() function can cause a double free vulnerability when NF_DROP is issued with a drop error which resembles NF_ACCEPT. We recommend upgradi

5 repos

https://github.com/rootkalilocalhost/CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/Alicey0719/docker-POC_CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/Notselwyn/CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/kevcooper/CVE-2024-1086-checker

https://github.com/CCIEVoice2009/CVE-2024-1086

TomiMcCluskey at 2024-06-03T20:20:23.596Z ##

CISA confirms CVE-2024-1086 active attacks in the wild on Linux kernel versions 5.14-6.6.14 using netfilter vuln for privilege escalation. Major distros like Debian, Fedora, RHEL, Ubuntu affected. Check if you're patched with "uname -r".

Mitigation steps in article. Stay safe!

https://opensourcewatch.beehiiv.com/p/nasty-linux-bug-cve20241086-loose

##
avoidthehack at 2024-06-03T18:05:01.305Z ##

CISA warns of actively exploited #Linux privilege elevation flaw

Tracked as CVE-2024-1086 and confirmed exploitation in the wild. Successful exploitation could allow an attacker local access to gain privilege escalation - which could in turn result in root-level access.

Originally disclosed in JAN 2024.

This has been fixed in multiple stable kernel versions.

#cybersecurity #security #cve #infosec

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/cisa-warns-of-actively-exploited-linux-privilege-elevation-flaw/

##
realn2s at 2024-06-03T06:56:43.780Z ##

I want to link to a specific entry in the #CISA Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog.

And I don't know how 🥴
I feel totally stupid

Concrete to the (currently single) search result of https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog?search_api_fulltext=CVE-2024-1086

"Sharing" it only shares a link to the catalog.

Do you know how to do it?

#cybersecurity #fedipower

##
TomiMcCluskey at 2024-06-01T19:45:47.882Z ##

🔥 Notselwyn's latest blog post is a must-read for anyone interested in Linux kernel exploitation! 🐧

In "Flipping Pages," they dive deep into CVE-2024-1086, a double-free vulnerability in nf_tables, and demonstrates how to craft a powerful Linux Privilege Escalation exploit. 🚨

Notselwyn walks us through his entire process, from finding the bug to developing novel techniques.

Key highlights:

🔸 mitigations like KASLR, KPTI, SMAP, and SMEP
🔸 arbitrary R/W primitives from userland
🔸 exploitation for maximum stealth

Perhaps most impressive is the exploit's broad compatibility (thanks to data-only techniques) and rock-solid stability (93-99% success rate!). 💪

Whether you're a beginner looking to learn or a seasoned researcher seeking inspiration, this blogpost has something for you. It's clear that Notselwyn put a ton of effort into making this both educational and practical.

At the time of writing, the stable branches linux-5.15.y, linux-6.1.y, and linux-6.6.y are affected by this exploit, and perhaps linux-6.7.1

https://pwning.tech/nftables/

#Infosec #LinuxKernel #Exploitation #VulnerabilityResearch

🔥 Notselwyn's latest blog post is a must-read for anyone interested in Linux kernel exploitation! 🐧

In "Flipping Pages," they dive deep into CVE-2024-1086, a double-free vulnerability in nf_tables, and demonstrates how to craft a powerful Linux Privilege Escalation exploit. 🚨

🔸 arbitrary R/W primitives from userland
🔸 exploitation for maximum stealth

Perhaps most impressive is the exploit's broad compatibility (thanks to data-only techniques) and rock-solid stability (93-99% success rate!). 💪

##

CVE-2024-3400
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.70%

updated 2024-04-29T05:02:31

5 posts

A command injection vulnerability in the GlobalProtect feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software for specific PAN-OS versions and distinct feature configurations may enable an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the firewall. Fixes for PAN-OS 10.2, PAN-OS 11.0, and PAN-OS 11.1 are in development and are expected to be released by April 14, 2024. Cloud NG

Nuclei template

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-31T13:40:04.000Z ##

RedTail Cryptominer Evolves with Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Vulnerability https://thecyberexpress.com/redtail-cryptominer/ #PaloAltoPANOSCVE20243400vulnerability #PaloAltoPANOSvulnerability #privateCryptominingPools #TheCyberExpressNews #RedTailcryptominer #CybersecurityNews #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #DarkWebNews

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.382Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

Related story: https://thehackernews.com/2024/05/redtail-crypto-mining-malware.html @thehackernews

##

CVE-2023-3390
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-07T05:00:45

1 posts

A use-after-free vulnerability was found in the Linux kernel's netfilter subsystem in net/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c. Mishandled error handling with NFT_MSG_NEWRULE makes it possible to use a dangling pointer in the same transaction causing a use-after-free vulnerability. This flaw allows a local attacker with user access to cause a privilege escalation issue. We recommend upgrading past commit 1

1 repos

https://github.com/uthrasri/CVE-2023-33902_single_file

H3liumb0y at 2024-06-05T07:33:12.366Z ##

PoC released for Critical Privilege Escalation Vulnerability in Linux Kernel

Date: June 5, 2024

CVE: CVE-2023-3390

Vulnerability Type: Use-After-Free

CWE: [[CWE-416]]

Sources: SSD-disclosure NVD, Debian Security Tracker, Snyk

Synopsis

A PoC Exploit has been released for Linux Kernel use-after-free vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-3390, has been discovered in the Linux kernel's netfilter subsystem. This flaw, present in the nf_tables_api.c file, can allow a local attacker with the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system to escalate privileges due to mishandled error handling. The vulnerability has been patched.

Issue Summary

CVE-2023-3390 is a critical vulnerability found in the Linux kernel's netfilter subsystem. The issue arises from a use-after-free error in the NFT_MSG_NEWRULE handling, potentially allowing attackers to exploit a dangling pointer within the same transaction. This flaw enables local attackers to gain elevated privileges on affected systems.

Technical Key Findings

The root cause of CVE-2023-3390, a critical privilege escalation vulnerability in the Linux kernel, lies in the improper management of integer values within the nft_parse_register_store function of the Netfilter subsystem. Specifically, this vulnerability is due to an integer overflow issue within the nft_validate_register_store function, which fails to correctly handle certain large values for register indices.

The CVE-2023-3390 vulnerability arises from an integer overflow in the validation logic of the Netfilter subsystem, which fails to properly handle large register values, allowing an attacker to perform out-of-bounds writes to kernel memory. This leads to potential privilege escalation, compromising the affected system. It is crucial to apply patches that correct this validation flaw to mitigate the risk.

For details, see the detailed root cause analysis at SSD Secure Disclosure

Vulnerable Products

The vulnerability affects Debian 11 (Linux Kernel 5.10)

Impact Assessment

Exploiting this vulnerability allows a local attacker to gain root access, which can lead to severe consequences such as system compromise, data breaches, and service disruptions.

Patches or Workaround

Patches for CVE-2023-3390 have been released. Administrators are advised to update their Linux kernel to versions that include the commit 1240eb93f0616b21c675416516ff3d74798fdc97.  an updated kernel in July 2023: https://tracker.debian.org/news/1449040/accepted-linux-510179-3-source-into-oldstable-security

Tags

#CVE-2023-3390 #LinuxKernel #PrivilegeEscalation #UseAfterFree #Netfilter #SecurityPatch #Debian #AlmaLinux #Ubuntu2404

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-28T13:49:26.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-23108: Fortinet FortiSIEM 2nd Order Command Injection Deep-Dive
Fortinet back at it again with another deep dive of Fortinet FortiSIEM. After providing the vulnerability analysis for CVE-2023-34992 (see parent toot above), he briefly explains how CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 are patch bypasses. As @wdormann points out, "The injection-causing semicolon is moved from one argument to another. 🤦‍♂️" Proof of concept is provided.

You've read about it in Bleeping Computer's news article. Check out the vulnerability disclosure timeline here to see Zach Hanley's side of the story about Fortinet's botched disclosure.

#CVE_2024_23108 #proofofconcept #vulnerability #Horizon3 #Fortinet

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-28T13:38:34.000Z ##

@wdormann I was there for this! someone noticed some perfect 10.0 CVSSv3 scoring vulnerabilities buried in a 4 month old security advisory without any changelog.

@serghei asked Fortinet PSIRT about them and they straight up lied about it: https://mastodon.social/@serghei/111889892600716875

Zach Hanley's response: https://twitter.com/hacks_zach/status/1755309941982646695

Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to

@BleepingComputer posted a subsequent update with the following statement: "After contacting Fortinet once again, we were told their previous statement was “misstated” and that the two new CVEs are variants of the original flaw."

"The PSIRT team followed its process to add two similar variants of the previous CVE (CVE-2023-34992), tracked as CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 to our public advisory FG-IR-23-130, which was published in October 2023. The two new CVEs share the exact same description and score as the initial one; in parallel we updated MITRE. A reminder pointing to the updated Advisory will be included for our customers on Tuesday when Fortinet publishes its monthly advisory." – Fortinet.”

screaminggoat at 2024-05-31T19:12:41.700Z ##

Cloudflare:Disrupting FlyingYeti's campaign targeting Ukraine
Cloudflare disrupted a phishing campaign by Russia-aligned threat actor (FlyingYeti aka UAC-0149) targeting Ukraine. FlyingYeti used debt-themed lures regarding the end of Ukraine's eviction and utility service termination moratorium in January 2024. The infection chain starts with malicious files leveraging CVE-2023-38831 (7.8 high, disclosed 23 August 2023 by Group-IB as an exploited zero-day: WinRAR Code Execution Vulnerability) eventually resulting in COOKBOX malware. The campaign was detected on 18 April 2024 with several weeks of reconnaissance/weaponization activity before being successfully disrupted. Cloudflare provides provide recommendations, detections (including PowerShell, Microsoft Sentinel, and Splunk scripts), and indicators of compromise. Extremely impressive write-up.

#threatintel #UAC0149 #FlyingYeti #IOC #cyberespionage #Ukraine #Russia #RussiaUkraineWar #CVE_2023_38831

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-31T19:12:41.000Z ##

Cloudflare:Disrupting FlyingYeti's campaign targeting Ukraine
Cloudflare disrupted a phishing campaign by Russia-aligned threat actor (FlyingYeti aka UAC-0149) targeting Ukraine. FlyingYeti used debt-themed lures regarding the end of Ukraine's eviction and utility service termination moratorium in January 2024. The infection chain starts with malicious files leveraging CVE-2023-38831 (7.8 high, disclosed 23 August 2023 by Group-IB as an exploited zero-day: WinRAR Code Execution Vulnerability) eventually resulting in COOKBOX malware. The campaign was detected on 18 April 2024 with several weeks of reconnaissance/weaponization activity before being successfully disrupted. Cloudflare provides provide recommendations, detections (including PowerShell, Microsoft Sentinel, and Splunk scripts), and indicators of compromise. Extremely impressive write-up.

#threatintel #UAC0149 #FlyingYeti #IOC #cyberespionage #Ukraine #Russia #RussiaUkraineWar #CVE_2023_38831

CVE-2023-38606
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.26%

updated 2024-04-04T06:22:38

2 posts

This issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 16.6 and iPadOS 16.6, macOS Big Sur 11.7.9, macOS Monterey 12.6.8, tvOS 16.6, watchOS 9.6, macOS Ventura 13.5, iOS 15.7.8 and iPadOS 15.7.8. An app may be able to modify sensitive kernel state. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited against versions of iOS released before iOS 15

##

CVE-2019-15901
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.25%

updated 2024-04-04T02:31:21

2 posts

An issue was discovered in slicer69 doas before 6.2 on certain platforms other than OpenBSD. A setusercontext(3) call with flags to change the UID, primary GID, and secondary GIDs was replaced (on certain platforms: Linux and possibly NetBSD) with a single setuid(2) call. This resulted in neither changing the group id nor initializing secondary group ids.

brokenix@emacs.ch at 2024-05-29T22:46:49.000Z ##

#doas : multiple security issues
Buffer overflow (privilege escalation to root)
Broken UID parsing falls back to root (CVE-2019-15900)
Incorrect group change behaviour (CVE-2019-15901)
https://github.com/slicer69/doas/pull/23

##
brokenix@emacs.ch at 2024-05-29T22:46:49.000Z ##

#doas : multiple security issues
Buffer overflow (privilege escalation to root)
Broken UID parsing falls back to root (CVE-2019-15900)
Incorrect group change behaviour (CVE-2019-15901)
https://github.com/slicer69/doas/pull/23

CVE-2024-3094
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 13.34%

updated 2024-03-29T18:30:50

2 posts

Malicious code was discovered in the upstream tarballs of xz, starting with version 5.6.0. The tarballs included extra .m4 files, which contained instructions for building with automake that did not exist in the repository. These instructions, through a series of complex obfuscations, extract a prebuilt object file from one of the test archives, which is then used to modify specific functions in t

Nuclei template

BenjaminHCCarr@hachyderm.io at 2024-05-30T16:47:01.000Z ##

#XZ 5.6.2 Released With The Frightening #Backdoor Removed
Lasse Collin released XZ 5.6.2 today with the CVE-2024-3094 backdoor cleared out that was present in the former v5.6 and v5.6.1 releases.
Lasse Collin also announced that Sam James has stepped up as a supporting maintainer moving forward for the XZ project.
The XZ 5.6.2 release also has a few bug fixes.
https://www.phoronix.com/news/XZ-5.6.2-Released

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-03T18:18:25.045Z ##

Summoning Team: Molding Lies Into Reality || Exploiting CVE-2024-4358
SinSinology of Summoning Team provides an exploit chain for CVE-2024-4358 (9.8 critical disclosed 29 May 2024 by Progress) Progress Telerik Report Server authentication bypass and CVE-2024-1800 (9.9 critical, disclosed 20 March 2024 by Progress) deserialization of untrusted data. The result is full pre-authenticated remote code execution. He provides a root cause analysis and a proof of concept.

h/t: @BleepingComputer Exploit for critical Progress Telerik auth bypass released, patch now cc: @cR0w

#CVE_2024_4358 #CVE_2024_1800 #Progress #Telerik #vulnerability #proofofconcept #POC

The result is full pre-authenticated remote code execution. He provides a root cause analysis and a proof of concept.

Shadowserver reporting exploitation attempts: https://infosec.exchange/@shadowserver/112568641063171625

We are observing Progress Telerik Report Server CVE-2024-4358 auth bypass exploitation attempts in our honeypot sensors starting 5th June. We have also started reporting out vulnerable versions seen in our scans (89 seen on 5th June out of 95 exposed).

CVE-2023-48788
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 71.08%

updated 2024-03-19T09:30:32

4 posts

A improper neutralization of special elements used in an sql command ('sql injection') in Fortinet FortiClientEMS version 7.2.0 through 7.2.2, FortiClientEMS 7.0.1 through 7.0.10 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via specially crafted packets.

1 repos

https://github.com/horizon3ai/CVE-2023-48788

screaminggoat at 2024-06-04T13:03:07.568Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2023-48788: Revisiting Fortinet FortiClient EMS to Exploit 7.2.X
Horizon3 concluded that their exploit from the previous deep-dive on CVE-2023-48788 (9.8 critical, disclosed 22 February 2024 by Fortinet, with proof of concept by Horizon3) only affected FortiClient EMS 7.0.x versions. They discuss the differences in exploitation between FortiClient EMS's two mainline versions: 7.0.x and 7.2.x. Horizon3 also includes insights into the issues surrounding the exploit development for CVE-2023-48788 to determine success.

#CVE_2023_48788 #Fortinet #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #POC #FortiClient

Horizon3 also includes insights into the issues surrounding the exploit development for CVE-2023-48788 to determine success.

##

CVE-2024-2194
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-13T18:31:44

2 posts

The WP Statistics plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the URL search parameter in all versions up to, and including, 14.5 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

AAKL at 2024-05-30T15:29:37.602Z ##

Fastly (published yesterday): Active exploitation of unauthenticated stored XSS vulnerabilities in #WordPress Plugins - CVE-2024-2194, CVE-2023-6961, and CVE-2023-40000 https://www.fastly.com/blog/active-exploitation-unauthenticated-stored-xss-vulnerabilities-wordpress/ #cybersecurity #infosec

Related story: https://thehackernews.com/2024/05/researchers-uncover-active-exploitation.html @thehackernews

CVE-2019-15900
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.24%

updated 2024-02-16T18:31:02

2 posts

An issue was discovered in slicer69 doas before 6.2 on certain platforms other than OpenBSD. On platforms without strtonum(3), sscanf was used without checking for error cases. Instead, the uninitialized variable errstr was checked and in some cases returned success even if sscanf failed. The result was that, instead of reporting that the supplied username or group name did not exist, it would exe

brokenix@emacs.ch at 2024-05-29T22:46:49.000Z ##

#doas : multiple security issues
Buffer overflow (privilege escalation to root)
Broken UID parsing falls back to root (CVE-2019-15900)
Incorrect group change behaviour (CVE-2019-15901)

CVE-2024-21412

https://github.com/lsr00ter/CVE-2024-21412_Water-Hydra

H3liumb0y at 2024-06-04T08:36:55.507Z ##

DarkGate Malware Switches to AutoHotkey for Advanced Evasion Techniques

Date: June 2024
CVE: CVE-2023-36025, CVE-2024-21412
Vulnerability Type: Remote Code Execution, Information Disclosure
CWE: [[CWE-22]], [[CWE-427]]
Sources: McAfee , Trend Micro, The Hacker News

Synopsis

DarkGate malware, known for its stealth and versatility, has recently transitioned from using AutoIt to AutoHotkey for its attack scripts. This shift enhances its evasion capabilities against security software, posing a renewed threat to targeted systems.

Issue Summary

The DarkGate malware has been active since 2018, offering a range of malicious functions including remote access, keylogging, and data theft. In its latest iteration, observed in March 2024, the malware has switched from AutoIt to AutoHotkey scripts to bypass detection mechanisms such as Microsoft Defender SmartScreen. The malware is distributed through phishing emails containing malicious HTML or Excel attachments.

Technical Key Findings

DarkGate initiates its attack via a phishing email, tricking users into opening a malicious HTML or Excel file. This file exploits security flaws in Microsoft Defender SmartScreen, allowing a Visual Basic Script to execute PowerShell commands that launch an AutoHotkey script. This script then downloads and executes the DarkGate payload.

Vulnerable Products

  • Microsoft Windows systems running outdated or unpatched versions of Microsoft Defender SmartScreen
  • Any systems susceptible to phishing attacks via email clients

Impact Assessment

When exploited, DarkGate can provide attackers with full remote access to compromised systems. This includes capabilities for credential theft, keylogging, screen capturing, and installing additional malware, significantly jeopardizing the integrity and security of affected systems.

Patches or Workarounds

N.A.

Tags

#DarkGate #Malware #CVE-2023-36025 #CVE-2024-21412 #AutoHotkey #RemoteAccessTrojan #Phishing #MicrosoftDefender #CyberSecurity #threatintelligence

screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.382Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.000Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

##

CVE-2024-23109
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-02-05T15:30:29

2 posts

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSIEM version 7.1.0 through 7.1.1 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.2 and 6.7.0 through 6.7.8 and 6.6.0 through 6.6.3 and 6.5.0 through 6.5.2 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.2 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via via crafted API requests.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-28T13:49:26.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-23108: Fortinet FortiSIEM 2nd Order Command Injection Deep-Dive
Fortinet back at it again with another deep dive of Fortinet FortiSIEM. After providing the vulnerability analysis for CVE-2023-34992 (see parent toot above), he briefly explains how CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 are patch bypasses. As @wdormann points out, "The injection-causing semicolon is moved from one argument to another. 🤦‍♂️" Proof of concept is provided.

You've read about it in Bleeping Computer's news article. Check out the vulnerability disclosure timeline here to see Zach Hanley's side of the story about Fortinet's botched disclosure.

#CVE_2024_23108 #proofofconcept #vulnerability #Horizon3 #Fortinet

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-28T13:38:34.000Z ##

@wdormann I was there for this! someone noticed some perfect 10.0 CVSSv3 scoring vulnerabilities buried in a 4 month old security advisory without any changelog.

@serghei asked Fortinet PSIRT about them and they straight up lied about it: https://mastodon.social/@serghei/111889892600716875

Zach Hanley's response: https://twitter.com/hacks_zach/status/1755309941982646695

Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to

@BleepingComputer posted a subsequent update with the following statement: "After contacting Fortinet once again, we were told their previous statement was “misstated” and that the two new CVEs are variants of the original flaw."

"The PSIRT team followed its process to add two similar variants of the previous CVE (CVE-2023-34992), tracked as CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 to our public advisory FG-IR-23-130, which was published in October 2023. The two new CVEs share the exact same description and score as the initial one; in parallel we updated MITRE. A reminder pointing to the updated Advisory will be included for our customers on Tuesday when Fortinet publishes its monthly advisory." – Fortinet.”

CVE-2024-23108
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-02-05T15:30:28

7 posts

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSIEM version 7.1.0 through 7.1.1 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.2 and 6.7.0 through 6.7.8 and 6.6.0 through 6.6.3 and 6.5.0 through 6.5.2 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.2 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via via crafted API requests.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.382Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

##

The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

CVE-2023-46218
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-01-25T15:31:52

2 posts

This flaw allows a malicious HTTP server to set "super cookies" in curl that are then passed back to more origins than what is otherwise allowed or possible. This allows a site to set cookies that then would get sent to different and unrelated sites and domains. It could do this by exploiting a mixed case flaw in curl's function that verifies a given cookie domain against the Public Suffix List (

bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-05-30T07:13:14.000Z ##

#Windows users running stupid scanners now contact us for support regarding CVE-2023-46218 which the scanners say affects #curl 8.4.0 shipped by Microsoft.

It would, if their version was built to use #iibpsl, a prereq for this CVE, which #Microsoft does not.

Security scanners. A snake oil business.

https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2023-46218.html

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.000Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

##

CVE-2023-36025
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.46%

updated 2023-11-14T18:30:28

1 posts

Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

3 repos

https://github.com/ka7ana/CVE-2023-36025

https://github.com/coolman6942o/-EXPLOIT-CVE-2023-36025

https://github.com/J466Y/test_CVE-2023-36025

H3liumb0y at 2024-06-04T08:36:55.507Z ##

DarkGate Malware Switches to AutoHotkey for Advanced Evasion Techniques

Date: June 2024
CVE: CVE-2023-36025, CVE-2024-21412
Vulnerability Type: Remote Code Execution, Information Disclosure
CWE: [[CWE-22]], [[CWE-427]]
Sources: McAfee , Trend Micro, The Hacker News

Synopsis

DarkGate malware, known for its stealth and versatility, has recently transitioned from using AutoIt to AutoHotkey for its attack scripts. This shift enhances its evasion capabilities against security software, posing a renewed threat to targeted systems.

Issue Summary

The DarkGate malware has been active since 2018, offering a range of malicious functions including remote access, keylogging, and data theft. In its latest iteration, observed in March 2024, the malware has switched from AutoIt to AutoHotkey scripts to bypass detection mechanisms such as Microsoft Defender SmartScreen. The malware is distributed through phishing emails containing malicious HTML or Excel attachments.

Technical Key Findings

DarkGate initiates its attack via a phishing email, tricking users into opening a malicious HTML or Excel file. This file exploits security flaws in Microsoft Defender SmartScreen, allowing a Visual Basic Script to execute PowerShell commands that launch an AutoHotkey script. This script then downloads and executes the DarkGate payload.

Vulnerable Products

  • Microsoft Windows systems running outdated or unpatched versions of Microsoft Defender SmartScreen
  • Any systems susceptible to phishing attacks via email clients

Impact Assessment

When exploited, DarkGate can provide attackers with full remote access to compromised systems. This includes capabilities for credential theft, keylogging, screen capturing, and installing additional malware, significantly jeopardizing the integrity and security of affected systems.

Patches or Workarounds

N.A.

Tags

#DarkGate #Malware #CVE-2023-36025 #CVE-2024-21412 #AutoHotkey #RemoteAccessTrojan #Phishing #MicrosoftDefender #CyberSecurity #threatintelligence

CVE-2023-33246
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.23%

updated 2023-11-07T05:06:39

2 posts

For RocketMQ versions 5.1.0 and below, under certain conditions, there is a risk of remote command execution.  Several components of RocketMQ, including NameServer, Broker, and Controller, are leaked on the extranet and lack permission verification, an attacker can exploit this vulnerability by using the update configuration function to execute commands as the system users that RocketMQ is runnin

screaminggoat at 2024-06-05T14:59:25.895Z ##

Aqua: Muhstik Malware Targets Message Queuing Services Applications
Aqua Nautilus discovered a new campaign of Muhstik malware targeting message queuing services applications such as Apache RocketMQ. The attackers downloaded Muhstik onto the compromised instances by exploiting CVE-2023-33246 (9.8 critical, disclosed 23 May 2023 by Apache, added to KEV Catalog 06 September 2023. Apache RocketMQ Command Execution Vulnerability). Aqua describes the vulnerability exploitation, attacker actions on objective, and provide IOC.

#threatintel #IOC #Muhstik #CVE_2023_33246

screaminggoat at 2024-06-04T15:45:55.536Z ##

@campuscodi On 30 May 2024, Trend Micro reported that the Chinese financially motivated threat actor group 8220 Gang (who they call Water Sigbin) exploited the vulnerabilities CVE-2017-3506 and CVE-2023-21839 to deploy a cryptocurrency miner via a PowerShell script: https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/e/decoding-8220-latest-obfuscation-tricks.html

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T13:30:30.566Z ##

Trend Micro: Decoding Water Sigbin's Latest Obfuscation Tricks
Trend Micro writes about the 8220 gang, a Chinese financially motivated threat actor group known for deploying cryptominers in cloud-based environments and Linux servers. They write about the exploitation of Oracle WebLogic vulnerabilities CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) and CVE-2023-21839 (7.5 high) to deploy a cryptocurrency miner via a PowerShell script. They provide an analysis of the bat file. IOC and MITRE ATT&CK TTPs provided.

#8220gang #WaterSigbin #threatintel #cryptominer #IOC #CVE_2017_3506 #CVE_2023_21839

##

CVE-2022-30203
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2023-05-26T05:00:45

4 posts

Windows Boot Manager Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability.

1 repos

https://github.com/Wack0/dubiousdisk

Rairii@social.nano.lgbt at 2024-06-07T15:43:08.164Z ##

let's smash the brittle glass that is windows boot security again!

Introducing dubious disk (CVE-2022-30203, CVE-2023-21560, CVE-2023-28269, CVE-2023-28249, and more...), the Porygon-Z that's super effective against Secure Boot!

Writeup with exploitro is linked above (came third in Field-FX 2024 Wild compo!).

Exploiting this bug leads to code execution in the context of a boot application, which defeats Secure Boot, BitLocker on the OS partition (code execution is obtained either at a point where the payload can still derive keys via TPM, or when the derived keys are in memory), and measured boot (code execution is obtained before the running boot application really measures much of anything to TPM PCRs).

Microsoft has to this point taken over two years and five attempts to fix this issue.

#infosec #SecureBoot #CVE_2022_30203 #CVE_2023_21560 #CVE_2023_28269 #CVE_2023_28249

CVE-2023-28450
(7.5 HIGH)

updated 2023-04-17T03:30:19

1 posts

An issue was discovered in Dnsmasq before 2.90. The default maximum EDNS.0 UDP packet size was set to 4096 but should be 1232 because of DNS Flag Day 2020.

#infosec #SecureBoot #CVE_2022_30203 #CVE_2023_21560 #CVE_2023_28269 #CVE_2023_28249

##

CVE-2023-28269
(6.2 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2023-04-11T21:31:08

4 posts

Windows Boot Manager Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

1 repos

https://github.com/Wack0/dubiousdisk

Rairii@social.nano.lgbt at 2024-06-07T15:43:08.164Z ##

let's smash the brittle glass that is windows boot security again!

Introducing dubious disk (CVE-2022-30203, CVE-2023-21560, CVE-2023-28269, CVE-2023-28249, and more...), the Porygon-Z that's super effective against Secure Boot!

Writeup with exploitro is linked above (came third in Field-FX 2024 Wild compo!).

Exploiting this bug leads to code execution in the context of a boot application, which defeats Secure Boot, BitLocker on the OS partition (code execution is obtained either at a point where the payload can still derive keys via TPM, or when the derived keys are in memory), and measured boot (code execution is obtained before the running boot application really measures much of anything to TPM PCRs).

Microsoft has to this point taken over two years and five attempts to fix this issue.

#infosec #SecureBoot #CVE_2022_30203 #CVE_2023_21560 #CVE_2023_28269 #CVE_2023_28249

##
Rairii@social.nano.lgbt at 2024-06-07T15:43:08.164Z ##

let's smash the brittle glass that is windows boot security again!

Introducing dubious disk (CVE-2022-30203, CVE-2023-21560, CVE-2023-28269, CVE-2023-28249, and more...), the Porygon-Z that's super effective against Secure Boot!

Microsoft has to this point taken over two years and five attempts to fix this issue.

CVE-2023-20938
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2023-03-14T05:06:51

5 posts

In binder_transaction_buffer_release of binder.c, there is a possible use after free due to improper input validation. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-257685302References: Upstream kernel

ycombinator@rss-mstdn.studiofreesia.com at 2024-06-04T23:57:59.000Z ##

##

CVE-2019-2054
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2023-03-08T05:05:37

2 posts

In the seccomp implementation prior to kernel version 4.8, there is a possible seccomp bypass due to seccomp policies that allow the use of ptrace. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation. Product: Android Versions: Android kernel Android ID: A-119769499

jschauma@mstdn.social at 2024-06-06T13:53:19.000Z ##

@jpetazzo Hmm. 'ptrace' is included twice; once gated by kernel version >=4.8 (https://github.com/moby/moby/blob/master/profiles/seccomp/default.json#L419), which addresses CVE-2019-2054, and one gated by CAP_SYS_PTRACE (https://github.com/moby/moby/blob/master/profiles/seccomp/default.json#L739). So that seems ok for the default config, although I've seen people copy ungated 'ptrace' into the list of allowed calls, which at least opens up CVE-2019-2054 for vulnerable kernels.

But 'prctl' should allow you to change the filter itself, and 'seccomp' could be used to disable seccomp, I think?

##
jschauma@mstdn.social at 2024-06-06T13:53:19.000Z ##

@jpetazzo Hmm. 'ptrace' is included twice; once gated by kernel version >=4.8 (https://github.com/moby/moby/blob/master/profiles/seccomp/default.json#L419), which addresses CVE-2019-2054, and one gated by CAP_SYS_PTRACE (https://github.com/moby/moby/blob/master/profiles/seccomp/default.json#L739). So that seems ok for the default config, although I've seen people copy ungated 'ptrace' into the list of allowed calls, which at least opens up CVE-2019-2054 for vulnerable kernels.

But 'prctl' should allow you to change the filter itself, and 'seccomp' could be used to disable seccomp, I think?

##

CVE-2023-25717
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.69%

updated 2023-02-23T16:26:54.490000

1 posts

Ruckus Wireless Admin through 10.4 allows Remote Code Execution via an unauthenticated HTTP GET Request, as demonstrated by a /forms/doLogin?login_username=admin&password=password$(curl substring.

Nuclei template

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-28T14:49:25.000Z ##

Sysdig: DDoS-as-a-Service: The Rebirth Botnet
Sysdig reports a DDoS-as-a-Service Mirai-based botnet using the domain rebirthltd[.]com to launch attacks. One of the vulnerabilities targeted is a Ruckus AP remote code execution/cross-site request forgery vulnerability CVE-2023-25717 (9.8 critical, disclosed 08 February 2023 by Ruckus, has proof of concept, added to CISA KEV Catalog on 12 May 2023).Sysdig describes motivations, attribution, campaigns, infection methods, and detection methods. IOC not really included.

#threatintel #ddos #botnet #CVE_2023_25717 #ruckus #mirai #rebirth #vulcan

##

CVE-2012-1823(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 97.44%

updated 2023-02-03T05:00:39

10 posts

sapi/cgi/cgi_main.c in PHP before 5.3.12 and 5.4.x before 5.4.2, when configured as a CGI script (aka php-cgi), does not properly handle query strings that lack an = (equals sign) character, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by placing command-line options in the query string, related to lack of skipping a certain php_getopt for the 'd' case.

Nuclei template

6 repos

https://github.com/Fatalitysec/CVE-2012-1823

https://github.com/drone789/CVE-2012-1823

https://github.com/tardummy01/oscp_scripts-1

https://github.com/0xl0k1/CVE-2012-1823

https://github.com/Unix13/metasploitable2

https://github.com/cyberharsh/PHP_CVE-2012-1823

screaminggoat at 2024-06-07T11:29:43.476Z ##

watchTowr: No Way, PHP Strikes Again! (CVE-2024-4577)
watchTowr explains CVE-2024-4577 (critical severity, disclosed 06 June 2024) which is a remote code execution vulnerability in all versions of PHP on the Windows operating system according to the vulnerability reporters. watchTowr in attempting to reproduce the vulnerability notes that it is similar to an older bug CVE-2012-1823. They were able to successfully replicate it and provide a proof of concept.

#CVE_2024_4577 #PHP #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2012_1823

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T11:29:43.000Z ##

##
dangoodin at 2024-06-07T18:17:58.748Z ##

Researchers have discovered a critical RCE in PHP for Windows. CVE-2024-4577 allows unauthenticated people to bypass the protection for a previously fixed vulnerability (CVE-2012-1823) using specific character sequences. Arbitrary code can be executed on remote PHP servers through the argument injection attack.

https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/

##
isotopp@chaos.social at 2024-06-07T11:46:16.000Z ##

CVE-2024-4577 - PHP CGI Argument Injection Vulnerability

https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/

This exploit uses a specific feature of Windows, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-ucoderef/d1980631-6401-428e-a49d-d71394be7da8 to inject code into a running CGI PHP.EXE on Windows, if Windows is running with Japanese, Simplified or Traditional Chinese Code Pages, bypassing a mitigation for a 2012 exploit, CVE-2012-1823

##

CVE-2017-5705
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2023-02-02T05:07:30

1 posts

Multiple buffer overflows in kernel in Intel Manageability Engine Firmware 11.0/11.5/11.6/11.7/11.10/11.20 allow attacker with local access to the system to execute arbitrary code.

mkukri@mas.to at 2024-05-26T12:48:36.000Z ##

@Evv1L @libreleah

This uses CVE-2017-5705.

It has been fixed by Intel in newer ME v11.x.x.x firmware releases, however ME11 hardware has no protection again downgrading the ME version by overwriting the SPI flash physically, thus we can downgrade to a vulnerable version.

After downgrade, we exploit the bup module of the vulnerable firmware, overwriting the copy of boot guard FPFs stored in SRAM, resulting in the fused boot guard configuration being replaced with our desired one.

##

CVE-2017-3506
(7.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 86.86%

updated 2023-02-02T05:01:24

19 posts

Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server component of Oracle Fusion Middleware (subcomponent: Web Services). Supported versions that are affected are 10.3.6.0, 12.1.3.0, 12.2.1.0, 12.2.1.1 and 12.2.1.2. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unaut

Nuclei template

3 repos

https://github.com/Al1ex/CVE-2017-3506

https://github.com/ianxtianxt/CVE-2017-3506

https://github.com/0xn0ne/weblogicScanner

screaminggoat at 2024-06-03T14:30:52.891Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) Oracle WebLogic Server OS Command Injection Vulnerability to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog based on evidence of active exploitation.

Shoutout to @hrbrmstr for the KEV Catalog RSS feed https://github.com/hrbrmstr/kev-push

#CVE_2017_3506 #Oracle #Weblogic #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #CISA #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiiesCatalog

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T13:30:30.566Z ##

Trend Micro: Decoding Water Sigbin's Latest Obfuscation Tricks
Trend Micro writes about the 8220 gang, a Chinese financially motivated threat actor group known for deploying cryptominers in cloud-based environments and Linux servers. They write about the exploitation of Oracle WebLogic vulnerabilities CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) and CVE-2023-21839 (7.5 high) to deploy a cryptocurrency miner via a PowerShell script. They provide an analysis of the bat file. IOC and MITRE ATT&CK TTPs provided.

#8220gang #WaterSigbin #threatintel #cryptominer #IOC #CVE_2017_3506 #CVE_2023_21839

##

Sempf at 2024-06-05T03:40:33.721Z ##

CISA added a seven (!) year old bug in Weblogic to the KEV list.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-3506

Now, I know instant patching is not in the cards, and that's ok, but seven years? Comeon man.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-04T15:45:55.536Z ##

@campuscodi On 30 May 2024, Trend Micro reported that the Chinese financially motivated threat actor group 8220 Gang (who they call Water Sigbin) exploited the vulnerabilities CVE-2017-3506 and CVE-2023-21839 to deploy a cryptocurrency miner via a PowerShell script: https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/e/decoding-8220-latest-obfuscation-tricks.html

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-06-04T15:40:04.000Z ##

CISA has updated its KEV database with a new vulnerability currently actively exploited in the wild, a 2017 Oracle WebLogic command injection tracked as CVE-2017-3506.

Changes this is used for crypto-mining... over 90% :nigmathink:

jbhall56 at 2024-06-04T11:14:04.263Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2017-3506 (CVSS score: 7.4), the issue concerns an operating system (OS) command injection vulnerability that could be exploited to obtain unauthorized access to susceptible servers and take complete control. https://thehackernews.com/2024/06/oracle-weblogic-server-os-command.html

##

CVE-2017-0199
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.45%

updated 2023-02-02T05:00:30

4 posts

Microsoft Office 2007 SP3, Microsoft Office 2010 SP2, Microsoft Office 2013 SP1, Microsoft Office 2016, Microsoft Windows Vista SP2, Windows Server 2008 SP2, Windows 7 SP1, Windows 8.1 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted document, aka "Microsoft Office/WordPad Remote Code Execution Vulnerability w/Windows API."

25 repos

https://github.com/NotAwful/CVE-2017-0199-Fix

screaminggoat at 2024-06-07T15:34:29.525Z ##

Fortinet: New Agent Tesla Campaign Targeting Spanish-Speaking People
A new phishing campaign spreads a new Agent Tesla variant targeting Spanish-speaking people. The campaign leverages multiple techniques to deliver the Agent Tesla core module. The following vulnerabilities are exploited and mentioned in this blog:

  • CVE-2017-0199 (7.8 high, disclosed 12 April 2017 by Microsoft, in KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office/WordPad Remote Code Execution
  • CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2017 by Microsoft, in KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability

Fortinet describes the infection chain, provides technical analyses into the malware, and lists what sensitive information is stolen from victims and exfiltrated to an FTP server. IOC provided.

#agenttesla #malware #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2017_0199 #CVE_2017_11882 #eitw

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T15:34:29.000Z ##

  • CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2017 by Microsoft, in KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability

Fortinet describes the infection chain, provides technical analyses into the malware, and lists what sensitive information is stolen from victims and exfiltrated to an FTP server. IOC provided.

##

CVE-2018-20062
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.68%

updated 2023-02-01T05:07:52

16 posts

An issue was discovered in NoneCms V1.3. thinkphp/library/think/App.php allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via crafted use of the filter parameter, as demonstrated by the s=index/\think\Request/input&filter=phpinfo&data=1 query string.

2 repos

https://github.com/NS-Sp4ce/thinkphp5.XRce

https://github.com/yilin1203/CVE-2018-20062

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-06-06T18:05:04.000Z ##

Chinese Hackers Exploit Old ThinkPHP Vulnerabilities in New Attacks https://www.securityweek.com/chinese-hackers-exploit-old-thinkphp-vulnerabilities-in-new-attacks/ #Malware&Threats #Vulnerabilities #CVE201820062 #CVE20199082 #ThinkPHP #Akamai

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-06-06T18:05:04.000Z ##

Chinese Hackers Exploit Old ThinkPHP Vulnerabilities in New Attacks https://www.securityweek.com/chinese-hackers-exploit-old-thinkphp-vulnerabilities-in-new-attacks/ #Malware&Threats #Vulnerabilities #CVE201820062 #CVE20199082 #ThinkPHP #Akamai

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-05T14:51:38.338Z ##

Akamai: 2024: Old CVEs, New Targets — Active Exploitation of ThinkPHP
Akamai reports a cyberespionage campaign that targets ThinkPHP applications that are vulnerable to CVE-2018-20062 and CVE-2019-9082, by likely Chinese-speaking threat actors. The campaign seems to have started in as early as October 2023 by targeting a limited number of customers/organizations. It only recently became widespread. The attacks originated from various IP addresses associated with servers hosted on the "Zenlayer" cloud provider (ASN 21859), primarily located in Hong Kong. The exploit attempts to retrieve additional obfuscated code from another compromised ThinkPHP server to gain initial foothold. After successfully exploiting the system, the attackers will install a Chinese language web shell named Dama to maintain persistent access to the server. Subsequent actions may involve spreading further within the victim's data center or enlisting the server for use in attack infrastructure. No IOC.

#China #cyberespionage #threatintel #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2019_9082

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.382Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-05T14:51:38.000Z ##

Akamai: 2024: Old CVEs, New Targets — Active Exploitation of ThinkPHP
Akamai reports a cyberespionage campaign that targets ThinkPHP applications that are vulnerable to CVE-2018-20062 and CVE-2019-9082, by likely Chinese-speaking threat actors. The campaign seems to have started in as early as October 2023 by targeting a limited number of customers/organizations. It only recently became widespread. The attacks originated from various IP addresses associated with servers hosted on the "Zenlayer" cloud provider (ASN 21859), primarily located in Hong Kong. The exploit attempts to retrieve additional obfuscated code from another compromised ThinkPHP server to gain initial foothold. After successfully exploiting the system, the attackers will install a Chinese language web shell named Dama to maintain persistent access to the server. Subsequent actions may involve spreading further within the victim's data center or enlisting the server for use in attack infrastructure. No IOC.

#China #cyberespionage #threatintel #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2019_9082

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062

The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. ##

CVE-2017-11882
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.44%

updated 2023-02-01T05:03:36

2 posts

Microsoft Office 2007 Service Pack 3, Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2, Microsoft Office 2013 Service Pack 1, and Microsoft Office 2016 allow an attacker to run arbitrary code in the context of the current user by failing to properly handle objects in memory, aka "Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2017-11884.

##

CVE-2022-26134
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.51%

updated 2023-01-27T05:03:24

2 posts

In affected versions of Confluence Server and Data Center, an OGNL injection vulnerability exists that would allow an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on a Confluence Server or Data Center instance. The affected versions are from 1.3.0 before 7.4.17, from 7.13.0 before 7.13.7, from 7.14.0 before 7.14.3, from 7.15.0 before 7.15.2, from 7.16.0 before 7.16.4, from 7.17.0 before 7.17

Nuclei template

screaminggoat at 2024-05-31T14:31:33.304Z ##

One of the IP addresses in the IOC provided by Check Point (see parent toot above) 156.146.56.136 was previously reported by Volexity in Zero-Day Exploitation of Atlassian Confluence (02 June 2022). CVE-2022-26134 (9.8 critical, disclosed 02 June 2022 by Atlassian as an exploited zero-day) Confluence Data Center and Server RCE was exploited by likely Chinese actors:

Volexity has reason to believe this exploit is currently in use by multiple threat actors and that the likely country of origin of these attackers is China.

There is a very likely link to Chinese threat actors based on the zero-day exploitation of a VPN. Following Cisco's reporting of ArcaneDoor campaign by state-sponsored actors (likely China) on 24 April 2024. cc: @campuscodi @hrbrmstr @zeljkazorz

#CVE_2024_24919 #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC #threatintel #China #cyberespionage

CVE-2022-22954
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.41%

updated 2023-01-27T05:01:41

2 posts

VMware Workspace ONE Access and Identity Manager contain a remote code execution vulnerability due to server-side template injection. A malicious actor with network access can trigger a server-side template injection that may result in remote code execution.
