screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.382Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.000Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954

##

CVE-2019-9082
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.45%

updated 2022-04-05T20:42:47.120000

12 posts

ThinkPHP before 3.2.4, as used in Open Source BMS v1.1.1 and other products, allows Remote Command Execution via public//?s=index/\think\app/invokefunction&function=call_user_func_array&vars[0]=system&vars[1][]= followed by the command.

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-06-06T18:05:04.000Z ##

Chinese Hackers Exploit Old ThinkPHP Vulnerabilities in New Attacks https://www.securityweek.com/chinese-hackers-exploit-old-thinkphp-vulnerabilities-in-new-attacks/ #Malware&Threats #Vulnerabilities #CVE201820062 #CVE20199082 #ThinkPHP #Akamai

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-06-06T18:05:04.000Z ##

Chinese Hackers Exploit Old ThinkPHP Vulnerabilities in New Attacks https://www.securityweek.com/chinese-hackers-exploit-old-thinkphp-vulnerabilities-in-new-attacks/ #Malware&Threats #Vulnerabilities #CVE201820062 #CVE20199082 #ThinkPHP #Akamai

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-05T14:51:38.338Z ##

Akamai: 2024: Old CVEs, New Targets — Active Exploitation of ThinkPHP
Akamai reports a cyberespionage campaign that targets ThinkPHP applications that are vulnerable to CVE-2018-20062 and CVE-2019-9082, by likely Chinese-speaking threat actors. The campaign seems to have started in as early as October 2023 by targeting a limited number of customers/organizations. It only recently became widespread. The attacks originated from various IP addresses associated with servers hosted on the "Zenlayer" cloud provider (ASN 21859), primarily located in Hong Kong. The exploit attempts to retrieve additional obfuscated code from another compromised ThinkPHP server to gain initial foothold. After successfully exploiting the system, the attackers will install a Chinese language web shell named Dama to maintain persistent access to the server. Subsequent actions may involve spreading further within the victim's data center or enlisting the server for use in attack infrastructure. No IOC.

#China #cyberespionage #threatintel #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2019_9082

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-05T14:51:38.000Z ##

https://github.com/xcanwin/CVE-2024-4577-PHP-RCE

ks982579@techhub.social at 2024-06-08T13:55:32.000Z ##

A new critical security flaw (CVE-2024-4577) affecting all versions of PHP on Windows has been disclosed. This CGI argument injection vulnerability allows remote code execution by bypassing protections from a previous flaw (CVE-2012-1823).

Key Points:

Impacts all PHP versions on Windows
Allows argument injection and remote code execution
Bypasses previous CVE-2012-1823 protections
Affects XAMPP installations with specific locales by default
Patches available in PHP 8.3.8, 8.2.20, and 8.1.29

Admins are urged to update PHP immediately as exploitation attempts have already been detected. Switching to more secure solutions like Mod-PHP, FastCGI, or PHP-FPM is also recommended.

This simple yet critical bug highlights the importance of thorough security reviews and timely patching.

#PHPSecurity #CVE20244577 #RemoteCodeExecution #CyberSecurity #SoftwareVulnerability #WindowsOS #WebAppSecurity

HackerNews: https://thehackernews.com/2024/06/new-php-vulnerability-exposes-windows.html

##
habr@zhub.link at 2024-06-08T12:02:14.000Z ##

[Перевод] CVE-2024-4577: Не может быть, PHP опять под атакой

Orange Tsai недавно запостил про «Одну из уязвимостей PHP, которая влияет на XAMPP, развернутый с настройками по умолчанию», и нам было интересно рассказать немного об этом. XAMPP - очень популярный способ администраторов и разработчиков развернуть Apache, PHP и множество других инструментов, и любая ошибка, которая может быть RCE в установке этого набора по умолчанию, звучит очень заманчиво. Где нашлась очередная уязвимость PHP? Читайте далее.

https://habr.com/ru/articles/820409/

#CVE20244577 #CVE #PHP #phpcgi #xampp #rce #watchtowr #уязвимости #уязвимости_php #уязвимость

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-07T11:29:43.476Z ##

watchTowr: No Way, PHP Strikes Again! (CVE-2024-4577)
watchTowr explains CVE-2024-4577 (critical severity, disclosed 06 June 2024) which is a remote code execution vulnerability in all versions of PHP on the Windows operating system according to the vulnerability reporters. watchTowr in attempting to reproduce the vulnerability notes that it is similar to an older bug CVE-2012-1823. They were able to successfully replicate it and provide a proof of concept.

#CVE_2024_4577 #PHP #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2012_1823

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T11:29:43.000Z ##

They were able to successfully replicate it and provide a proof of concept.

##
josephzeng at 2024-06-08T03:01:24.663Z ##

[CVE-2024-4577] The Best-Fit feature in Windows encoding conversion allows attackers to bypass protections by interpreting soft hyphens (0xAD) as real hyphens (0x2D), enabling code execution.

POC:
https://github.com/TAM-K592/CVE-2024-4577
https://github.com/11whoami99/CVE-2024-4577

Write-ups: https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/
https://labs.watchtowr.com/no-way-php-strikes-again-cve-2024-4577/

#php #vulnerability

##
shaknais@mastodon.social at 2024-06-07T22:05:26.000Z ##

Just in time for the weekend!

CVE-2024-4577: Proof of Concept Available for PHP-CGI Argument Injection Vulnerability

https://buaq.net/go-244036.html

#PHP #Vulnerability #Critical

##
kpwn at 2024-06-07T20:45:25.768Z ##

🚨 Windows-based #PHP is vulnerable to #RCE when used in #CGI mode 🚨

The soft hyphen character (­­­­0xAD) is not escaped by the CGI handler. PHP applies it's best fit mapping and turns it into a real hyphen (0x2D).

This allows additional command line arguments to be passed to php.exe, ultimately leading to RCE.

Full details here: https://labs.watchtowr.com/no-way-php-strikes-again-cve-2024-4577/

#Pentesting #AppSec #InfoSec #CyberSecurity #BugBounty #Hacking

##
rickoooooo@social.authbypass.com at 2024-06-07T18:44:24.000Z ##

@clearbluejar I was reading you're post about CVE North Stars last night thinking it made a lot of sense and today I'm reading about this php bug and it just further drove the point home https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-07T18:35:11.942Z ##

@dangoodin better to look at the watchTowr article https://labs.watchtowr.com/no-way-php-strikes-again-cve-2024-4577/ which has the proof of concept and root cause specified.

Also the exploitation attempts observed by Shadowserver: https://infosec.exchange/@shadowserver/112575314920464732

##
dangoodin at 2024-06-07T18:17:58.748Z ##

Researchers have discovered a critical RCE in PHP for Windows. CVE-2024-4577 allows unauthenticated people to bypass the protection for a previously fixed vulnerability (CVE-2012-1823) using specific character sequences. Arbitrary code can be executed on remote PHP servers through the argument injection attack.

https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/

isotopp@chaos.social at 2024-06-07T11:46:16.000Z ##

CVE-2024-4577 - PHP CGI Argument Injection Vulnerability

https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/

This exploit uses a specific feature of Windows, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-ucoderef/d1980631-6401-428e-a49d-d71394be7da8 to inject code into a running CGI PHP.EXE on Windows, if Windows is running with Japanese, Simplified or Traditional Chinese Code Pages, bypassing a mitigation for a 2012 exploit, CVE-2012-1823

##
sublimer@mstdn.sublimer.me at 2024-06-07T10:45:46.000Z ##

CVE-2024-4577、なかなかにすごそう

No Way, PHP Strikes Again! (CVE-2024-4577) : 👀
---
https://labs.watchtowr.com/no-way-php-strikes-again-cve-2024-4577/

swapgs at 2024-06-07T09:26:00.649Z ##

matdevdug@c.im at 2024-06-08T15:01:39.000Z ##

##
josephzeng@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-08T03:01:24.000Z ##

[CVE-2024-4577] The Best-Fit feature in Windows encoding conversion allows attackers to bypass protections by interpreting soft hyphens (0xAD) as real hyphens (0x2D), enabling code execution.

POC:
https://github.com/TAM-K592/CVE-2024-4577
https://github.com/11whoami99/CVE-2024-4577

Write-ups: https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/
https://labs.watchtowr.com/no-way-php-strikes-again-cve-2024-4577/

#php #vulnerability

##
shaknais@mastodon.social at 2024-06-07T22:05:26.000Z ##

Just in time for the weekend!

CVE-2024-4577: Proof of Concept Available for PHP-CGI Argument Injection Vulnerability

https://buaq.net/go-244036.html

#PHP #Vulnerability #Critical

##
kpwn@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T20:45:25.000Z ##

🚨 Windows-based #PHP is vulnerable to #RCE when used in #CGI mode 🚨

The soft hyphen character (­­­­0xAD) is not escaped by the CGI handler. PHP applies it's best fit mapping and turns it into a real hyphen (0x2D).

This allows additional command line arguments to be passed to php.exe, ultimately leading to RCE.

Full details here: https://labs.watchtowr.com/no-way-php-strikes-again-cve-2024-4577/

#Pentesting #AppSec #InfoSec #CyberSecurity #BugBounty #Hacking

##
rickoooooo@social.authbypass.com at 2024-06-07T18:44:24.000Z ##

@clearbluejar I was reading you're post about CVE North Stars last night thinking it made a lot of sense and today I'm reading about this php bug and it just further drove the point home https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T18:35:11.000Z ##

@dangoodin better to look at the watchTowr article https://labs.watchtowr.com/no-way-php-strikes-again-cve-2024-4577/ which has the proof of concept and root cause specified.

Also the exploitation attempts observed by Shadowserver: https://infosec.exchange/@shadowserver/112575314920464732

##
dangoodin@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T18:17:58.000Z ##

Researchers have discovered a critical RCE in PHP for Windows. CVE-2024-4577 allows unauthenticated people to bypass the protection for a previously fixed vulnerability (CVE-2012-1823) using specific character sequences. Arbitrary code can be executed on remote PHP servers through the argument injection attack.

https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T16:09:53.000Z ##

PHP fixes critical #RCE flaw impacting all versions of #Windows - CVE-2024-4577 https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/php-fixes-critical-rce-flaw-impacting-all-versions-for-windows/ @BleepingComputer #cybersecurity #infosec

Devcore (posted yesterday): Security Alert: CVE-2024-4577 - PHP CGI Argument Injection Vulnerability https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/

CVE-2024-29404
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-06-05T16:10:15.335Z ##

Cisco security advisory: Cisco Finesse Web-Based Management Interface Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-20404 (7.2 high) Cisco Finesse SSRF Vulnerability: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Finesse could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct an SSRF attack on an affected system.
  • CVE-2024-20405 (7.2 high) Cisco Finesse Stored XSS through RFI Vulnerability: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Finesse could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a stored XSS attack by exploiting an RFI vulnerability.

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

#Cisco #PatchTuesday #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_29404 #CVE_2024_29405

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-05T16:10:15.000Z ##

Cisco security advisory: Cisco Finesse Web-Based Management Interface Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-20404 (7.2 high) Cisco Finesse SSRF Vulnerability: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Finesse could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct an SSRF attack on an affected system.
  • CVE-2024-20405 (7.2 high) Cisco Finesse Stored XSS through RFI Vulnerability: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Finesse could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a stored XSS attack by exploiting an RFI vulnerability.

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

  • Kibana 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-15): CVE-2024-37279 (4.3 medium) Kibana Broken Access Control issue (note: DoS?)
  • Elastic Cloud Enterprise 3.7.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-08) CVE-2023-45288 (aka HTTP/2 Continuation Flood, 5.4 medium, disclosed 03 April 2024) Uncontrolled Resource Consumption through HTTP/2 endpoints
  • Elasticsearch 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-13): CVE-2024-23445 (5.0 medium) Elasticsearch Remote Cluster Search Cross Cluster API Key insufficient restrictions

No mention of exploitation.

CVE-2024-35200
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-06-01T18:45:17.124Z ##

@neustradamus For context, nginx is a popular open source web server (HTTP and reverse proxy server, mail proxy server, and generic TCP/UDP proxy server). Shodan search shows 34,582,612 worldwide, with the U.S. and China almost tied in the high 7 million each. The following vulnerabilities were fixed 29 May 2024:

  • CVE-2024-32760 (6.5 med) OOB write to DoS (or worse)
  • CVE-2024-31079 (4.8 med) stack buffer overflow to DoS
  • CVE-2024-35200 (5.3 med) Null pointer dereference to DoS
  • CVE-2024-34161 (5.3 med) UAF info disclosure

I think it's funny that F5 disclosed their own security advisories of these vulns as "final" because they don't affect any of their products.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-01T18:45:17.000Z ##

@neustradamus For context, nginx is a popular open source web server (HTTP and reverse proxy server, mail proxy server, and generic TCP/UDP proxy server). Shodan search shows 34,582,612 worldwide, with the U.S. and China almost tied in the high 7 million each. The following vulnerabilities were fixed 29 May 2024:

  • CVE-2024-32760 (6.5 med) OOB write to DoS (or worse)
  • CVE-2024-31079 (4.8 med) stack buffer overflow to DoS
  • CVE-2024-35200 (5.3 med) Null pointer dereference to DoS
  • CVE-2024-34161 (5.3 med) UAF info disclosure

I think it's funny that F5 disclosed their own security advisories of these vulns as "final" because they don't affect any of their products.

CVE-2024-34161
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-06-01T18:45:17.124Z ##

@neustradamus For context, nginx is a popular open source web server (HTTP and reverse proxy server, mail proxy server, and generic TCP/UDP proxy server). Shodan search shows 34,582,612 worldwide, with the U.S. and China almost tied in the high 7 million each. The following vulnerabilities were fixed 29 May 2024:

  • CVE-2024-32760 (6.5 med) OOB write to DoS (or worse)
  • CVE-2024-31079 (4.8 med) stack buffer overflow to DoS
  • CVE-2024-35200 (5.3 med) Null pointer dereference to DoS
  • CVE-2024-34161 (5.3 med) UAF info disclosure

I think it's funny that F5 disclosed their own security advisories of these vulns as "final" because they don't affect any of their products.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-01T18:45:17.000Z ##

@neustradamus For context, nginx is a popular open source web server (HTTP and reverse proxy server, mail proxy server, and generic TCP/UDP proxy server). Shodan search shows 34,582,612 worldwide, with the U.S. and China almost tied in the high 7 million each. The following vulnerabilities were fixed 29 May 2024:

  • CVE-2024-32760 (6.5 med) OOB write to DoS (or worse)
  • CVE-2024-31079 (4.8 med) stack buffer overflow to DoS
  • CVE-2024-35200 (5.3 med) Null pointer dereference to DoS
  • CVE-2024-34161 (5.3 med) UAF info disclosure

I think it's funny that F5 disclosed their own security advisories of these vulns as "final" because they don't affect any of their products.

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-28T15:33:17.000Z ##

#CISA entries today:

- CVE-2024-5274 KEV catalogue entry: #Google Chromium V8 Type Confusion Vulnerability https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-5274

- One Industrial Control Systems Advisory: Campbell Scientific CSI Web Server https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/05/28/cisa-releases-one-industrial-control-systems-advisory @cisacyber #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-28T15:08:39.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds the Google Chrome zero-day CVE-2024-5274 (see parent toot above for information) to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog.

#CVE_2024_5274 #zeroday #vulnerability #CVE #KEV #eitw #activeexploitation #Chrome

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-25T17:38:59.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) Chromium security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.
  • CVE-2024-5274 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses these vulnerabilities. Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

Note: These vulnerabilities were disclosed on Tuesday 21 May 2024 (see parent toot above) and the zero-day on Thursday 23 May 2024.

#CVE_2024_5157 #CVE_2024_5158 #CVE_2024_5159 #CVE_2024_5160 #CVE_2024_5274 #vulnerability #CVE #MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-28T13:41:33.000Z ##

Citrix security advisory: Citrix Workspace app for Mac Security Bulletin for CVE-2024-5027
CVE-2024-5027 (7.7 high) Elevation of privilege from a local authenticated user to a root user (IF they have local authenticated user access to the device where Citrix Workspace App for Mac is installed). No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_5027 #Citrix #vulnerability #CVE #PatchTuesday

CVE-2021-30860
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.23%

1 posts

N/A

3 repos

https://github.com/Levilutz/CVE-2021-30860

https://github.com/30440r/gex

https://github.com/jeffssh/CVE-2021-30860

koteisaev@mastodon.online at 2024-05-30T16:11:44.000Z ##

//The #Pegasus sent an iMessage to its targets that contained what appeared to be GIF images, but which in fact contained a JBIG2 image. A vulnerability in the Xpdf implementation of JBIG2, re-used in Apple's iOS phone operating software, allowed Pegasus to construct an emulated computer architecture inside the JBIG2 stream which was then used to implement the zero-click attack. Apple fixed the vulnerability in iOS 14.8 in September 2021 as CVE-2021-30860 //
👻 😱 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pegasus_(spyware)

##

CVE-2024-5514
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.09%

2 posts

N/A

sbeyer@ioc.exchange at 2024-05-30T09:39:04.000Z ##

It is 2024 and some vendors still think this is a good idea:

(...) contains a HIDDEN ADMINISTRATOR ACCOUNT with a FIXED PASSWORD that CANNOT BE REMOVED OR DISABLED from the management interface. Remote attackers who obtain this account can BYPASS IP ACCESS CONTROL RESTRICTIONS and log in to the backend system WITHOUT BEING RECORDED in the system logs.

https://cve.threatint.com/CVE/CVE-2024-5514

#cybersecurity #cve #vulnerability #failure

CVE-2024-36365
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T19:25:35.427Z ##

HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible
  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE

HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible
  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T13:41:20.034Z ##

JetBrains security advisory: TeamCity Major Bug-Fix Release for All Versions: Update Your Server Now
JetBrains, without revealing any details, discloses CVE-2024-36470. "We have since discovered that the security patch plugin doesn’t provide an optimal long-term way of protecting a TeamCity server from these vulnerabilities. In specific edge cases, it might still be possible to bypass the plugin."
EDIT: official NVD description for CVE-2024-36470 (CVSSv3: 8.1 high) was made available:

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases

TeamCity 2024.03.2 Release Notes states that "8 security issues were fixed."

#CVE #JetBrains #vulnerability #teamcity #CVE_2024_36470

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T19:25:35.000Z ##

HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible
  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T13:41:20.000Z ##

JetBrains security advisory: TeamCity Major Bug-Fix Release for All Versions: Update Your Server Now
JetBrains, without revealing any details, discloses CVE-2024-36470. "We have since discovered that the security patch plugin doesn’t provide an optimal long-term way of protecting a TeamCity server from these vulnerabilities. In specific edge cases, it might still be possible to bypass the plugin."
EDIT: official NVD description for CVE-2024-36470 (CVSSv3: 8.1 high) was made available:

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases

TeamCity 2024.03.2 Release Notes states that "8 security issues were fixed."

#CVE #JetBrains #vulnerability #teamcity #CVE_2024_36470

screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T19:25:35.427Z ##

HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible

  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases

  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible
  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T19:25:35.000Z ##

HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible
  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

CVE-2024-36368
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T19:25:35.427Z ##

HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible
  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T19:25:35.000Z ##

HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible
  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

CVE-2024-294919
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T18:58:48.170Z ##

Mnemonic has observed attacker exploitation of CVE-2024-294919 as a zero-day (see above parent toot) since at least 30 April 2024:

mnemonic has observed attempts of exploitation in customer environments since April 30, 2024.

The following IOCs have been observed in customer environments between April 30, 2024, and today (May 29, 2024):

  • Reconnaissance IP: 82.180.133[.]120
  • Exploitation IP: 87.120.8[.]173
  • Exploitation IP: 23.227.203[.]36
  • Exploitation IP: 203.160.68[.]12

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve #threatintel #IOC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T18:58:48.000Z ##

Mnemonic has observed attacker exploitation of CVE-2024-294919 as a zero-day (see above parent toot) since at least 30 April 2024:

mnemonic has observed attempts of exploitation in customer environments since April 30, 2024.

The following IOCs have been observed in customer environments between April 30, 2024, and today (May 29, 2024):

  • Exploitation IP: 87.120.8[.]173
  • Exploitation IP: 23.227.203[.]36
  • Exploitation IP: 203.160.68[.]12

CVE-2024-30056
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.09%

2 posts

N/A

1 repos

https://github.com/absholi7ly/Microsoft-Edge-Information-Disclosure

DarkWebInformer at 2024-05-29T15:17:16.927Z ##

🚨POC RELEASED🚨CVE-2024-30056 Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability

#DarkWeb #Cybersecurity #Security #Cyberattack #Cybercrime #Privacy #Infosec #CVE202430056 #Vulnerability

This is a vulnerability in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). The attacker was able to trick the user into revealing sensitive information without his knowledge.

https://x.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1795836553207456099

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T15:17:16.000Z ##

#DarkWeb #Cybersecurity #Security #Cyberattack #Cybercrime #Privacy #Infosec #CVE202430056 #Vulnerability

CVE-2024-5035
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

1 posts

N/A

jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-28T10:51:59.000Z ##

The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-5035, carries a CVSS score of 10.0. It impacts all versions of the router firmware including and prior to 1_1.1.6. It has been patched in version 1_1.1.7 released on May 24, 2024. https://thehackernews.com/2024/05/tp-link-gaming-router-vulnerability.html
